page.title: 16CRANLEIGH RECREATION CENTRE
page.content: Opened in 1970, the swimming pool was largely financed by the local people as a war memorial. The swimming area is a pool twenty- five metres long, sloping to a depth of ten feet to allow diving from a low board. Beginners use a warmer shallow pool. Today, the Recreation Centre includes four squash courts, two tennis courts and a sixteen-station multi-gym. A sports hall for badminton is planned. Ten swimming instructors teach twenty -five schools every week, with other classes for all ages,toddlers to senior-citizens and special lessons for the physically-handicapped. Coach- ing is given in squash and tennis and, in the school holidays, many other activities are arranged. { { }
